Description: Fragment of floor of North Ionian Late Wild Goat Style pottery plate with part of ring foot; glaze fired brown; pale slip; interior: maeander frieze between broad bands with added red bands lined in white; exterior; ring foot glazed; on underside, two narrow bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Belongs to the same vessel as Reading 26.2.38.
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 35, pl. 22, no. 7a-b)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.710)
